summary: This document is a response from TransUnion to a federal grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, dated August 25, 2020. It includes certification letters, the subpoena, and credit reports for three unnamed individuals as part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felony violations including conspiracy and wire fraud.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying letter requesting confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Paralegal Specialist
persons.context: Sent the attached grand jury subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Representative II
persons.context: Employee of TransUnion who certified and waived personal appearance before the grand jury, providing the requested credit reports.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, issued the grand jury subpoena to TransUnion, which the Representative II responded to with credit reports.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a grand jury subpoena to TransUnion for credit reports of three individuals.

events.title: TransUnion Submits Credit Reports
events.description: TransUnion's Litigation Support Department submitted credit reports in response to the grand jury subpoena, certifying their authenticity.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commanded TransUnion's custodian of records to appear before the grand jury, though personal appearance was waived.

locations: United States Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, Room 480, New York, NY
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is part of a federal grand jury investigation into suspected felony violations including conspiracy (18 U.S.C. § 371) and wire fraud (18 U.S.C. §§ 1343, 1346).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requested confidentiality, asking TransUnion not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to preserve the investigation.
Credit reports were requested for three individuals, but their names, dates of birth, and SSNs are redacted in the provided text.
TransUnion complied with the subpoena, providing credit reports and waiving the right to appear personally before the grand jury.
The investigation is being conducted by the FBI, with specific special agents listed as points of contact (names redacted).
